page.title: 01Farming
page.content: At{Coombers Farm}they have 400 acres of grassland and 180 dairy cows;each gives milk for 10 months.They are milked twice a day in a herringbone parlour,and give 1000 gallons per lactation.The milk is stored in cooled tanks straight after milking until collected by the Milk Marketing Board.In the winter the cows are kept in cow kennels and fed silage,but in the summer they graze in the fields. There are 5 workers on the farm and when they are not milking they make silage from grass.This is stored under plastic sheeting with tyres on top until it is needed. There are also calves,foals,cats and dogs on the farm.
